# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is a function that wraps a string to a specified text width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    line = ""
    lines = String[]
    
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = ""
        end
        
        if isempty(line)
            line = word
        else
            line = line * " " * word
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."

print(wrap_string(text))
```

This iterates through the words, keeping track of the current line length. When adding the next word would exceed the text width, it starts a new line. The lines are joined with newlines and returned.

With the default 10 character wrap width, the output would be:

```
Lorem ipsum
dolor sit
amet,
consectetur
adipiscing
elit, sed do
eiusmod
tempor
incididunt ut
labore et
dolore magna
aliqua.
```
